ids_info.name: workflow
ids_info.description: Description of the workflow that has produced this data entry. The workflow IDS can also be used to communicate information about workflow state between workflow components.

workflow/time_loop.documentation: Description of a workflow based on a time loop which calls components defined in component_list sequentially  during each cycle of the loop (workflow_cycle). Within workflow IDS: Description of the workflow that has produced this data entry. The workflow IDS can also be used to communicate information about workflow state between workflow components.

The workflow IDS can also be used to communicate information about workflow state between workflow components. Within time_loop container: Description of a workflow based on a time loop which calls components defined in component_list sequentially  during each cycle of the loop (workflow_cycle).

workflow/time_loop/time_end.documentation: Termination time for the workflow main time loop. Within workflow IDS: Description of the workflow that has produced this data entry. The workflow IDS can also be used to communicate information about workflow state between workflow components. Within time_loop container: Description of a workflow based on a time loop which calls components defined in component_list sequentially  during each cycle of the loop (workflow_cycle).

workflow/time_loop/workflow_cycle.documentation: Set of time slices corresponding to the beginning of workflow cycles (main time loop of the workflow). During each workflow cycle, active components compute their result during their given time_interval. Components having completed their computation are frozen until the end of the workflow cycle. The next workflow cycle begins when the maximum time_interval (over the components) has been reached. Within workflow IDS: Description of the workflow that has produced this data entry. The workflow IDS can also be used to communicate information about workflow state between workflow components. Within time_loop container: Description of a workflow based on a time loop which calls components defined in component_list sequentially  during each cycle of the loop (workflow_cycle).

workflow/time_loop/workflow_cycle/compon.documentation: Control parameters for the set of participting components defined in ../../component. Within workflow IDS: Description of the workflow that has produced this data entry. The workflow IDS can also be used to communicate information about workflow state between workflow components. Within time_loop container: Description of a workflow based on a time loop which calls components defined in component_list sequentially  during each cycle of the loop (workflow_cycle). Within workflow_cycle container: Set of time slices corresponding to the beginning of workflow cycles (main time loop of the workflow). During each workflow cycle, active components compute their result during their given time_interval. Components having completed their computation are frozen until the end of the workflow cycle. The next workflow cycle begins when the maximum time_interval (over the components) has been reached.

The next workflow cycle begins when the maximum time_interval (over the components) has been reached. Within component container: Control parameters for the set of participting components defined in ../../component.

Component execution mode for current workflow cycle. 0 means the component is not executed and the workflow uses results from previous workflow cycle. 1 means the component is executed for this workflow cycle. Within workflow IDS: Description of the workflow that has produced this data entry. The workflow IDS can also be used to communicate information about workflow state between workflow components. Within time_loop container: Description of a workflow based on a time loop which calls components defined in component_list sequentially  during each cycle of the loop (workflow_cycle). Within workflow_cycle container: Set of time slices corresponding to the beginning of workflow cycles (main time loop of the workflow). During each workflow cycle, active components compute their result during their given time_interval. Components having completed their computation are frozen until the end of the workflow cycle. The next workflow cycle begins when the maximum time_interval (over the components) has been reached. Within component container: Control parameters for the set of participting components defined in ../../component.
